preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: This exercise will require no code changes on your part. All interactions will be through a REST client. You will use the REST client to move a simple banking application through a defined state machine for opening the bank and managing an account.
Instructions for using the REST client are written using the Eclipse-based, JBoss Web Service Test Tool but other tools could be used in its place with the provided data.

chapter.title: Summary
chapter.para: During this exercise you should have noticed that the only things our client knew out-of-band was the representations and the meaning of the links. Our client did not know any URIs beyond the root URI to bootsrap the process. All URIs were provided at runtime as hrefs. Thus our application was hyperlink-driven or designed with Hyperlinks As The Engine Of Application State (HATEAOS) -- which is the final and core concept in REST beyond what is present in Level 2 HTTP Web Services.
